text: The 2015 Svenska Cupen Final was played on 17 May 2015. The match was played at Gamla Ullevi, the home ground of IFK Göteborg. It was the first time since 2011 that one of the final teams had a home ground instead of playing on the national stadium Friends Arena in Solna. It was the first time since 2000 that the final was played in Gothenburg and first time ever it was played on Gamla Ullevi. The final were the culmination of the 2014–15 Svenska Cupen. Allsvenskan clubs IFK Göteborg and Örebro SK contested the 2015 final. In Sweden the match was televised live on SVT. IFK Göteborg won their seventh Svenska Cupen title after defeating Örebro SK 2–1. ==Route to the final== Note: In all results below, the score of the finalist is given first. {|class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !colspan=2|IFK Göteborg !Round !colspan=2|Örebro SK |- style="background:#c1e0ff;" |Opponent |Result |Qualifying stage |Opponent |Result |- |align=left|Assyriska Turabdin IK |5–0 (A) | style="background:#c1e0ff;"|Round 2 |align=left|Eskilstuna City |2–0 (A) |- style="background:#c1e0ff;" |Opponent |Result |Group stage |Opponent |Result |- |align=left|FC Trollhättan |2–2 (A) | style="background:#c1e0ff;"|Matchday 1 |align=left|Varbergs BoIS |3–3 (H) |- |align=left|Myresjö/Vetlanda FK |6–0 (A) | style="background:#c1e0ff;"|Matchday 2 |align=left|Dalkurd FF |1–0 (A) |- |align=left|Ljungskile SK |5–0 (H) | style="background:#c1e0ff;"|Matchday 3 |align=left|Gefle IF |2–1 (H) |- | colspan="2" style="text-align:center;
